item.title: Signing your GitHub work with your Keybase keys
item.description: As you may know, yesterday, GitHub has presented a way to verify your commits on their platform. This is not something new, it’s part of the git protocol, but now, they will show a fancy “verified” label everytime you push a signed commit. Cool? Yeah, pretty cool. One of the problems I always had since I know GPG is to keep my keys locally. I am pretty sure that some other people take care of their keys as if they were part of their family, but I didn’t feel that need yet.
